abstract: Toyota and Ford are among the companies temporarily closing some plants and cutting hours because of a lack of parts.
snippet: Toyota and Ford are among the companies temporarily closing some plants and cutting hours because of a lack of parts.
lead_paragraph: The global auto industry, hindered by a shortage of parts from key factories in Japan after last month’s earthquake and tsunami, is still struggling to maintain steady production.

headline.main: Automakers Adjust Production to Quake-Related Shortages
headline.print_headline: Automakers Adjust Production To Quake-Related Shortages

byline.original: By Nick Bunkley and Bettina Wassener
